title: Week In Politics: Obama's Budget And 2016 Prospects
teaser: NPR's Charlie Mahtesian discusses the president's $4 trillion budget and who's gaining traction now that Mitt Romney's not running.
contentencoded:
The week in politics begins with the release of President Obama’s $4 trillion budget today, which Republicans are already slamming for its proposal to tax the inheritances of the wealthy in order to support tax breaks for the struggling middle class.

NPR’s Charlie Mahtesian joins Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson to discuss that, as well as which of the Republican presidential hopefuls are gaining traction, after Mitt Romney’s withdrawal on Friday from presidential politics.

Guest

  • Charlie Mahtesian, politics editor for NPR. He tweets @charlieNPR.
